126b887ca2ad7b0e75184e829da7f6d3a063e7cc.statement: China use AI-generated images of aircraft debris to spread disinformation about French Rafale jets

sources.title: China Ran Disinformation Campaign To Undermine Rafale Jet Sales After India-Pakistan Clash: US Report
sources.description: After the India-Pakistan border flare-up in May, triggered by the Pahalgam terror attacks, China allegedly launched a targeted disinformation campaign aimed at derailing French Rafale sales and promoting the sales of its own J-35 fighter jets.

sources.title: China accused of running disinformation campaign against French Rafale jets after India-Pakistan conflict
sources.description: China reportedly launched a disinformation campaign aimed at undermining sales of the French Rafale fighter jet after India used the aircraft in May against Chinese weapons deployed by Pakistan, according to a report from the bipartisan U.S.-China Economic and Security Review Commission. China has rejected the claims as false.

sources.title: Why Did Congress Echo China’s Rafale Fake Narrative? US Report Exposes China’s Disinformation Drive
sources.description: A US report revealing China’s anti-Rafale disinformation campaign has raised new questions about Congress’ similar claims during the 2025 India-Pakistan crisis. The overlap between Congress statements and Chinese narratives sparks political debate.

sources.title: Report Alleges China Behind Disinformation Campaign Following Operation Sindoor
sources.description: The US-China Economic and Security Review Commission accused China of orchestrating a disinformation campaign following India’s Operation Sindoor, alleging the use of fake AI images to influence aircraft sales and exploit the India-Pakistan conflict.

sources.title: How US Report Exposed China’s Disinformation Campaign Against Rafale During Op Sindoor
sources.description: A recent US report alleges that China orchestrated a disinformation campaign against India's Rafale fighter jets, using fake social media accounts.

sources.title: China ran campaign to discredit French Rafale fighter after India-Pakistan conflict
sources.description: China ran a disinformation campaign to hurt sales of the French Rafale fighter jet after India used the planes in May against Chinese weapons deployed by Pakistan, according to a bipartisan U.S. commission report.

sources.title: US Congress Advisory Body Says China Ran A Disinformation Campaign Against Rafale Jets | News18
sources.description: A major revelation has emerged from a US Congress advisory body, which has reported that China orchestrated a coordinated disinformation campaign targeting India’s Rafale fighter jets. According to the assessment, the campaign aimed to undermine India’s defence capabilities, weaken global trust in the Rafale program, and influence geopolitical perceptions in the Indo-Pacific region.

sources.title: China masterminded Rafale disinfo campaign: US report
sources.description: A US congressional report accuses China of orchestrating a disinformation campaign following India's Operation Sindoor, using fake social media accounts and AI-generated images of fabricated aircraft debris.

sources.title: Fake debris images? US flags China's 'disinformation campaign' against Rafale after Operation Sindoor — what it says
sources.description: A US report alleges China launched a disinformation campaign post-Operation Sindoor, using AI-generated images to discredit French Rafale sales and promote its own J-35 jets.

sources.title: China ran campaign to discredit French Rafale fighter after India-Pakistan conflict, US commission says
sources.description: China ran a disinformation campaign to hurt sales of the French Rafale fighter jet after India used the planes in May for the first time against Chinese weapons deployed by its neighbor Pakistan, a bipartisan US commission said this month in a report that the Chinese rejected as false information.

fc71551bb9207efaca3c45ca1ba2e605a43e7b1c.statement: China allegedly used fake social media accounts and AI-generated images to circulate fabricated “debris” of Rafale aircraft to undermine its sales and promote its own J-35 fighter jets

sources.title: China Ran Disinformation Campaign To Undermine Rafale Jet Sales After India-Pakistan Clash: US Report
sources.description: After the India-Pakistan border flare-up in May, triggered by the Pahalgam terror attacks, China allegedly launched a targeted disinformation campaign aimed at derailing French Rafale sales and promoting the sales of its own J-35 fighter jets.

sources.title: US Panel Accuses China of Disinformation After Operation Sindoor
sources.description: A new report by the US-China Economic and Security Review Commission has accused China of orchestrating a disinformation campaign in the aftermath of Operation Sindoor.

sources.title: How US Report Exposed China’s Disinformation Campaign Against Rafale During Op Sindoor
sources.description: A recent US report alleges that China orchestrated a disinformation campaign against India's Rafale fighter jets, using fake social media accounts.

sources.title: US report says China masterminded 'disinformation campaign' on Rafale after Operation Sindoor
sources.description: China mounted a coordinated disinformation campaign after India’s Operation Sindoor, aiming to undermine global confidence in Rafale fighter jets and promote its own J-35 aircraft, according to the annual report of the US–China Economic and Security Review Commission submitted to the US Congress.

sources.title: US report shows China ran disinformation campaign against Rafale after Op Sindoor
sources.description: Citing French intelligence, the report says Beijing also ran a disinformation operation aimed at undermining the Rafale aircraft deal and promoting the J-35 instead, spreading AI-generated and video-game images of fabricated Rafale “wreckage.”

sources.title: China mounted disinformation campaign to undercut Rafale sales after Op Sindoor: US report
sources.description: This assessment has appeared in a report submitted to the US Congress by the US–China Economic and Security Review Commission.

sources.title: A new U.S. report exposes China’s massive disinformation op after the May India–Pakistan clash
sources.description: A new U.S. report exposes China’s massive disinformation op after the May India–Pakistan clash — fake accounts, AI-generated ‘Rafale debris,’ and an attempt to derail India’s Rafale deal to push their J-35.

sources.title: CHAPTER 2: U.S.-CHINA SECURITY AND FOREIGN AFFAIRS (YEAR IN REVIEW)
sources.description: This chapter discusses China's actions over the past year, including its military modernization, gray zone tactics, and efforts to undermine U.S. credibility while presenting itself as a responsible global leader.
sources.source_name: U.S.-China Economic and Security Review Commission

sources.title: How US Report Exposed China’s Disinformation Campaign Against Rafale During Op Sindoor
sources.description: A recent US report alleges that China orchestrated a disinformation campaign against India's Rafale fighter jets, using fake social media accounts.
